application_type_full: Full planning & demolition in a conservation area
description: Demolition of the former police station and the erection of two buildings ranging between one to six storeys, providing 50 extra care homes for the elderly with shared facilities, community space at ground floor, cycle parking, landscaping and ancillary works.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted therewith (APL001 Rev A, APL002 Rev A, APL003 Rev A: Received 19/06/2023. APL011 Rev C, APL016 Rev B, APL019 Rev B, APL020 Rev B, APL021 Rev B: Received 30/11/2023.
APL004 Rev D, APL005 Rev D, APL012 Rev C, APL013 Rev C, APL014 Rev C, APL015 Rev C, APL017 Rev C: Received 11/12/2023.
APL006 Rev D, APL007 Rev D, APL008 Rev D, APL010 Rev D: Received 04/01/2024.
APL018 Rev D: Received 15/01/2024.
APL009 Rev E, Accommodation Schedule Rev C: Received 17/01/2024.
APL019 Rev B: Received 25/01/2024) and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 3 - Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved:
No development shall take place until a remediation method statement prepared by a suitably qualified, experienced or supervised person to specify the works necessary to render the site suitable for its proposed end use, has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. Works shall be carried out in accordance with the agreed details.

Condition : 4 - The Local Planning Authority shall be notified immediately if any land contamination not previously identified is encountered during development. A competent person shall assess the contamination, where necessary, including soil and groundwater sampling and testing before any further part of the development that may be affected by the additional contamination that has been discovered continues.
A revised remediation method statement, prepared by a suitably qualified, experienced or supervised person, shall be submitted in writing to the local planning authority for approval within one month of the discovery of such contamination. Works shall be carried out in accordance with the agreed details.

Condition : 5 - Prior to the first use of the development:
The agreed scheme for remediation, including any amendments, shall be fully implemented. A verification report produced upon completion of the remediation by a suitably qualified, experienced or supervised person shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority, before the development is first brought into use or in accordance with a programme approved in writing by the local planning authority.

Condition : 6 - Prior to commencement of groundworks (excluding site investigations and demolition), the applicant must submit in writing a final detailed drainage design including drawings and supporting calculations to the Local Planning Authority in consultation with the Lead Local Flood Authority for review and approval, aligned with the CWA-22-135-Drainage Statement Rev G [28/11/2023] and associated drawings. A detailed management plan confirming routine maintenance tasks for all drainage components must also be submitted to demonstrate how the drainage system is to be maintained for the lifetime of the development. Works shall be carried out in accordance with the agreed details.

Condition : 7 - Prior to first occupation of the development, evidence (photographs and installation contracts) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme for the site has been completed in accordance with the details agreed. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components.

Condition : 8 - No piling shall take place until a Piling Method Statement (detailing the depth and type of piling to be undertaken and the methodology by which such piling will be carried out, including measures to prevent and minimise the potential for damage to subsurface sewerage infrastructure, and the programme for the
works) has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority in consultation with Thames Water. Any piling must be undertaken in accordance with the terms of the approved piling method statement.

Condition : 9 - All Non-road Mobile Machinery (NRMM) used during the course of the development that is within the scope of the GLA ?Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition? Supplementary Planning Guidance (SPG) dated July 2014, or any successor document, shall comply with the emissions requirements therein.
Condition : 10 - All construction work shall be carried out in strict accordance with the measures specified within the Arboricultural Impact Assessment dated 9th May 2023.

Condition : 11 - Prior to the commencement of the development (except demolition, archaeological investigations, ground condition investigations and intrusive site surveys and other enabling works: site clearance; soil storage; remedial works in respect of any contamination or any other adverse ground conditions; erection of any temporary means of enclosure and land raising), an Ecological Enhancement Strategy, incorporating the recommendations of the ecological survey and dated 5th May 2023 and Technical Note: Biodiversity Net Gain Revision A report shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The Strategy shall detail the type and position of bird and bat boxes, log piles, green roof specifications, and other habitats of importance to increase species diversity. The strategy shall also include full details of a sensitive lighting scheme to protect proposed habitats on site. The strategy shall also include an ecological management and monitoring plan including long- term design objectives, management responsibilities and maintenance schedules for all landscaped areas (except privately owned gardens/terraces).
The approved Ecological Enhancement Strategy shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of the development. Any enhancement measures shall be maintained throughout the lifetime of the development.

Condition : 13 - Prior to the first occupation of the development, internal ambient sound testing shall be carried out that demonstrates that the requirements of Condition 12 have been achieved and the results shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Prior to the testing being carried out the proposed methodology shall be submitted in writing and approved by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 14 - The cumulative measured or calculated Rating Level of noise emitted from all mechanical services plant including heating, ventilation and air conditioning (HVAC) shall be 10dB(A) below the existing background noise level, at all times that the mechanical system operates. The measured or calculated noise levels shall be determined at the boundary of the nearest ground floor noise sensitive premises or 1 metre from the fa?ade of the nearest first floor (or higher) noise sensitive premises, and in accordance to the latest revision of British Standard 4142. The plant equipment shall also be designed to
achieve a Rating Level of 30dB LAr,T at the winter garden locations.

Condition : 15 - Based upon guidance contained within BS 5228:2009 + A1:2014: Noise, Noise levels from construction
works at nearby existing and proposed residential receptors shall not exceed the following
construction noise criteria:
-Daytime works will not exceed 75 dB LAeq,T at the worst-affected residential property during
the following time periods:
-Monday to Friday (08:00 ? 18:00 hours)
-Saturday (08:00 to 13:00 hours)
Works outside of the standard hours will be subject to prior agreement and prior notice will be provided to the London Borough of Hounslow.

Condition : 17 - Prior to the first occupation of flats hereby approved, evidence (schedule of fittings and manufactures literature) shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development would achieve the internal 105 litres per person per day target.

Condition : 18 - The development shall not be occupied until evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of installation contracts) has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development has been carried out in accordance with the following sustainable sourcing of materials requirements:
- At least three of the key elements of the building envelope (external walls, windows roof, upper floor slabs, internal walls, floor finishes/coverings) are to achieve a rating of A+ to D in the Building Research Establishment (BRE) The Green Guide of specification.
- At least 50% of timber and timber products are to be sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) scheme.
- No construction or insulation materials are to be used which would release toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete stratospheric ozone.

Condition : 19 - Prior to the commencement of development (except demolition, archaeological investigations, ground condition investigations and intrusive site surveys and other enabling works: site clearance; soil storage; remedial works in respect of any contamination or any other adverse ground conditions; erection of any temporary means of enclosure and land raising), evidence shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to show that the development has made sufficient provisions to enable the connection to a feasible district heating network in the future including a safeguarded pipe route for future connection at the site boundary. The development shall be constructed and completed in accordance with the agreed details.

Condition : 20 - a.) The development hereby permitted shall be implemented in accordance with the hereby approved Energy & Sustainability Strategy Rev B dated 12/07/2023, Approved Document O Compliance Report dated 07/05/2023.
b.) Prior to the first occupation of the development, evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and As-Built certificates under the Standard Assessment Procedure/National Calculation Method) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Statement to achieve a site-wide carbon reduction in emissions of 77% on Part L Building Regulations.
c.) Upon final commencement of operation of any low and zero carbon technologies, suitable devices for the monitoring of the low and zero carbon technologies shall have been installed, and the monitored data shall be submitted automatically to a monitoring web-platform at daily intervals for a period of three years from the point of full operation.

Condition : 21 - No development (except any demolition, site clearance, ground investigation and remediation work) shall take place until an Inclusive Access Strategy has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, which shall include: [details of the arrival, entrance and movement through the buildings ensuring a full automated solution, and how any level changes around the site would be overcome; and details of seating suitable for disabled carers]. The approved details shall be implemented fully before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use and shall be retained as such thereafter.

Condition : 22 - A minimum of 10% of the total dwellings shall be ?Wheelchair User Dwellings? built to Building Regulations M4(3). Proposed units shall be provided as identified on the hereby approved Proposed Ground Floor Plan (APL005 Rev D) and also identified on the Accommodation Schedule Rev C, with units B.01.02, B.01.04, and B.02.04 provided as M4(3) part 2(b) and shall be retained as such in perpetuity. All other dwellings shall be designed so that they meet building regulation M4(2) 'accessible and adaptable dwellings'.

Condition : 24 - Prior to the first use or occupation of the development, the cycle parking provision for the development shall be constructed in accordance with drawing (Proposed Ground Floor Plan APL005 Rev D). The cycle parking shall be fully implemented and made available for use before the first occupation of the development hereby approved and thereafter retained for use at all times without obstruction.

Condition : 25 - Prior to first occupation of the development, a Delivery and Servicing Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall accord with current guidance such as that issued by Transport for London and shall include measures required to ensure sufficient arrangements, physical as well as managerial, for the servicing, including emergency vehicle access, refuse collection of all aspects of the development, the timing of hours for deliveries by motor vehicles and a timetable for implementation. The plan shall include a management solution to ensure refuse bins are taken out for collection and returned to the bin stores after collection as well as details demonstrating where vehicles would stop for waste collection. The Plan shall be carried out as approved. The approved measures shall be implemented before the first occupation of the development hereby permitted and shall be so maintained for the life of the development.

Condition : 26 - Prior to first occupation of the development, a Travel Plan statement comprising continuing and long-term measures to promote sustainable travel and encourage a reduction in car use for all site users shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved Travel Plan statement shall thereafter be implemented, monitored and reviewed in accordance with the agreed Travel Plan targets and timescales to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 27 - The development shall achieve 'Secured by Design' accreditation awarded by the Design-Out Crime Officer from the Metropolitan Police Service on behalf of the Association of Chief Police Officers (ACPO). Prior to first occupation or use of the development, evidence of the accreditation achieved shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 28 - No development (except demolition, archaeological investigations, ground condition investigations and intrusive site surveys and other enabling works: site clearance; soil storage; remedial works in respect of any contamination or any other adverse ground conditions; erection of any temporary means of enclosure and land raising) shall take place until details (including product specifications) and samples of all external facing materials are submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The samples and details shall include:
i. brick/stonework (including brick/stone and mortar onsite sample panel min. 2m x 2m and details of the brick bonds)
ii. cladding materials (including system specifications/details and on-site samples (where relevant);
iii. window treatment (including sections/reveals and samples);
and
iv. balcony treatments (including details/sections/materials of the balustrading treatment and soffits)
v. rainwater downpipes and rainwater downpipe recesses
vi. any other materials/details to be used.
vii. drawings showing typical details for external windows, doors, building base and top, entrances, balconies and balustrades, and soffits.
viii. a schedule of all external materials and the extent of each material cross-referenced with all external elevations.
The development shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved details and maintained as such thereafter.

Condition : 30 - The green roof atop the single storey element of the Prince of Wales Terrace Block shall only be accessed for maintenance and shall not be used as a balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area.
